intro: Labatia tovarensis, commonly known as the Tovarensis bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of La Réunion in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in rocky or limestone soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branching. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Labatia tovarensis is considered an endangered species.
